stems.BSC: (to be) a state/act of medically treating, remedying something or someone; to treat [medically], to (try to) remedy something
stems.CSV: (to be) a physical act of treating/remedying

stems: (to be) a state/act of recuperation/healing/recovery; to recuperate, to heal, to recover
(to be) a state/act of restoration; to restore

stems.BSC: (to be) an act/state of administering a medicine/medicaton orally in solid form (e.g., pill, tablet, capsule, etc.); to administer a (solid) oral medication
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of being on a solid oral medication
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of swallowing a (solid) oral medication; to swallow a pill/tablet/capsule

stems: (to be) an act/state of administering a medicine/medication orally in liquid form (e.g., cough syrup, chemical dissolved in liquid, etc.); to administer a liquid medication
(to be) to be) an act/state of administering a medicine/medication via injection; to inject a medication

stems.BSC: (to be) an act of psychiatric treatment or therapeutic psychological therapy
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of being under or subject to psychiatric/psychological treatment/therapy
stems.CSV: (to be) a physical act of administering psychiatric/psychological treatment/therapy; to treat a patient by means of psychiatry/psychological therapy
stems.OBJ: (to be) the nature/specifics of a (course of) psychiatric/psychological therapy

stems: (to be) an act of subliminal psychological manipulation
(to be) an act of brainwashing [i.e., psychological manipulation to the extent that a person’s personality/motivations/values/memories/beliefs, etc. are changed for covert or nefarious purposes]

stems.BSC: (to be) an act/instance of bandaging a wound; to cover a wound with a bandage, to bandage a wound
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of protecting a wound by having a bandage on it; to have a bandage on
stems.CSV: (to be) a physical act of bandaging, to cover with a bandage

stems: (to be) an act/instance of using a pad/compress/dressing to absorb/staunch loss of blood or fluid
(to be) an act/instance of using a piece or section of material as a patch to cover, seal, and protect a wound or area of damage to something; to patch something

refers: MATERIAL USED AS BANDAGE or PATCH
